GIS.filehandling

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • GIS.filehandling.Database

  • public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    An Object Database can be instanced by handing over the needed connection parameters (Database name, Database port, Database user, user password and table name). With a Java Driver a connection to a Database can then be build up (method dbConnect). A Database table needs to have these three columns with the respective datatypes: gid (INTEGER AUTO INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY), type (VARCHAR(10)), geom (LONGTEXT).

    • Method Detail

      • dbConnect

        public java.sql.Connection dbConnect()
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        creates a db connection using the connection parameters
        Returns:
        Connection object when successful, SQLExeption if not
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - -

      • insertContent

        public void insertContent(Content c)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        get attribute id and type from all GIS objects in the content. Call the writeGeometryAsText method to get the geometry in something that you could call wellknowntext. Insert id, type and geometry in the respective DB columns return true when processed successful
        Parameters:
        c - Content with the actually drawn geometries
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - -

      • loadContent

        public Content loadContent()
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        load all rows stored in the DB and return a new Content. For each row 1. create a GIS object using the column values of ID and type. 2. Assign the coordinates using the method geometryAsTextToPoint, which will use as input parameter the string where the geometry as wellknowntext is saved. Store the Points in an Array List of the type Point.
        Returns:
        Content object with the loaded data from the DB
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - -
